title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Cook the spaghetti in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente.
Meanwhile, fry the pancetta or bacon in a large pan until crispy.
In a small bowl, beat the eggs and mix with the grated pecorino and parmesan cheeses.
Drain the spaghetti, reserving some of the cooking water.
Add the spaghetti to the pan with the pancetta, then remove the pan from the heat.
Quickly stir in the egg and cheese mixture, adding a little reserved pasta water to create a creamy sauce.
Season with freshly ground black pepper and salt to taste.
Serve immediately with extra cheese on top.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato-based gravy.
instructions: Marinate the chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala, turmeric, and chili powder for at least 1 hour.
Grill or cook the chicken on a high heat until cooked through and slightly charred.
In a large pan, melt the butter and fry the chopped onions until golden.
Add the canned tomatoes and cook until the sauce thickens.
Stir in the cream and add the grilled chicken pieces to the sauce.
Simmer for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is tender and the flavors have melded.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with rice or naan.

title: Margherita Pizza
summary: A simple yet delicious pizza made with fresh mozzarella, basil, and tomatoes.
instructions: Preheat the oven to the highest setting, preferably with a pizza stone inside.
Roll out the pizza dough on a lightly floured surface.
Spread a thin layer of olive oil on the dough and arrange the tomato slices on top.
Tear the mozzarella into small pieces and distribute evenly over the pizza.
Bake the pizza in the oven for 8-10 minutes, or until the crust is golden and the cheese has melted.
Remove from the oven, add fresh basil leaves, and season with salt and pepper.
Drizzle with extra olive oil and serve immediately.
